dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey, so, uh, big news from D.C. just before Trump leaves office, right? He signed this bill targeting Chinese companies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey, so, uh, big news from D C just before Trump leaves office, right? He signed this bill targeting Chinese companies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Donald Trump signed legislation that could remove Chinese companies from U.S. exchanges if American regulators are not allowed to review their financial audits. ... the bills measures are clearly intended to target Chinese companies... as President Trump prepares to leave office next month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's right, Host_A. It's called the Holding Foreign Companies Accountable Act. Basically, it means if foreign companies, like, don't let U.S. regulators review their financial audits, they could get kicked off our stock exchanges.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's right, Host A. It's called the Holding Foreign Companies Accountable Act. Basically, it means if foreign companies, like, don't let U S regulators review their financial audits, they could get kicked off our stock exchanges.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Donald Trump signed legislation that could remove Chinese companies from U.S. exchanges if American regulators are not allowed to review their financial audits. The Holding Foreign Companies Accountable Act will require companies to establish that they are not owned or controlled by a foreign government and allow the U.S. Public Accounting Oversight Board to review their financial audits.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and even though it applies to *any* foreign company, it's pretty clear who this is really aimed at, isn't it? [interrupts] I mean, China.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and even though it applies to any foreign company, it's pretty clear who this is really aimed at, isn't it? I mean, China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Although the legislation applies to companies from any country outside of the U.S., the bills measures are clearly intended to target Chinese companies, such as Alibaba Group, Pinduoduo and PetroChina.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Oh, absolutely. I mean, they're talking about companies like Alibaba Group, Pinduoduo, PetroChina... It's a pretty direct shot.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. I mean, they're talking about companies like Alibaba Group, Pinduoduo, PetroChina... It's a pretty direct shot.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Although the legislation applies to companies from any country outside of the U.S., the bills measures are clearly intended to target Chinese companies, such as Alibaba Group, Pinduoduo and PetroChina.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, uh, what's the timeframe for this? Like, do they just get booted immediately?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, uh, what's the timeframe for this? Like, do they just get booted immediately?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, there's a grace period. They actually get three years to comply, um, before they face losing access to, you know, our markets. Which, for them, is a huge source of capital.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, there's a grace period. They actually get three years to comply, um, before they face losing access to, you know, our markets. Which, for them, is a huge source of capital.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The companies have a grace period of three years to comply with the requirement before facing the threat of losing access to U.S. stock markets, a key source of capital for the companies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Three years. Okay. And this is definitely going to, like, ratchet up tensions with China even more, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Three years. Okay. And this is definitely going to, like, ratchet up tensions with China even more, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The bill will almost certainly escalate tensions between China and the U.S. as President Trump prepares to leave office next month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, almost certainly. I mean, Chinese authorities have always blocked overseas regulators from inspecting their local accounting firms, citing national security concerns.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, almost certainly. I mean, Chinese authorities have always blocked overseas regulators from inspecting their local accounting firms, citing national security concerns.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Chinese authorities have long blocked overseas regulators from inspecting local accounting firms, citing national security concerns.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's what I heard. But, you know, it's interesting â€“ this bill, it actually passed with pretty strong bipartisan support, didn't it? Unanimous votes in both the House and Senate.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's what I heard. But, you know, it's interesting - this bill, it actually passed with pretty strong bipartisan support, didn't it? Unanimous votes in both the House and Senate.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The measure passed the House by unanimous voice vote after passing the Senate in another unanimous vote in May this year. Legislation taking a hard line against China have been receiving bipartisan support this year amid rising tensions on a variety of fronts between the worlds two largest economies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it really shows, um, that hard line against China has broad appeal right now. But China's not happy. Their Foreign Ministry spokeswoman, Hua Chunying, she said it would undermine global investors' confidence in the U.S. markets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it really shows, um, that hard line against China has broad appeal right now. But China's not happy. Their Foreign Ministry spokeswoman, Hua Chunying, she said it would undermine global investors' confidence in the U S markets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Before the U.S. President had signed the bill, Chinas Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Hua Chunying told reporters, It will undermine global investors confidence in the U.S. capital markets and will undermine the U.S. capital markets global standing and hurt U.S. interests.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which, uh, you know, makes sense from their perspective. But I guess some of these companies have already started hedging their bets, right? Like, I saw Alibaba, NetEase... they've already pursued secondary listings elsewhere.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, uh, you know, makes sense from their perspective. But I guess some of these companies have already started hedging their bets, right? Like, I saw Alibaba, NetEase... they've already pursued secondary listings elsewhere.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In anticipation of the legislation, Chinese companies have pursued secondary listings in Hong Kong as a hedge against the potential ban from trading their shares in the U.S. Alibaba, NetEase and Yum China have already listed their shares in Hong Kong.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's right. Specifically, in Hong Kong. It's a way to, like, mitigate the risk. And it's actually made Hong Kong the world's second-largest IPO market this year, which is pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's right. Specifically, in Hong Kong. It's a way to, like, mitigate the risk. And it's actually made Hong Kong the world's second-largest I P O market this year, which is pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In anticipation of the legislation, Chinese companies have pursued secondary listings in Hong Kong... The citys stock exchange will finish the year as the worlds second-largest IPO market after raising a total of $50 billion in new listings, according to data compiled by KPMG.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, so, uh, definitely some ripple effects already happening. Interesting to see how this plays out in the long run.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, so, uh, definitely some ripple effects already happening. Interesting to see how this plays out in the long run.
